blogpost.blogcontent:
It's currently 3 A.M. and I honestly don't know what to put here. I regularly don't talk about myself, unless it was in my previous therapy sessions years ago when I was in Job Corps. I'm currently working on a few projects right now, this Neocities site being one of them. I'm also currently looking for a job hence the name "NEETDemon" (NEET in all caps when you spell the man name). Hopefully I can find something good, and preferably something remote because I don't have a car. I'm a little worried because I'm staying with a childhood friend and his family right now, but my time here in this house along with theirs is limited. They are really amazing people for helping me out when I am down on my luck, even when theirs isn't the best right now either, and I'm so thankful to have them in my life. I don't mean to sound depressed in my first blog post so I'm just going to get on with it.

While I try to find a job I'm trying to do more things to express myself during the down times of waiting. I guess for starter's since you're already here, here's a few things I'm *thinking* of doing to this website:


-- Dynamically creating blog and *possibly* other web pages using (unfortunately) more client side JavaScript, and fetching the data from my GitHub in the form of a markdown and parsing it to HTML. This is also a good way to get around the Neocities 1GB filehost limit, also so I don't go insane from constantly coding these blog posts in HTML.
-- Obviously finish the rest of this website.


... Yup, that's all I could think of right now. I swear I had more ideas before I even typed this section, but I'm just so dead tired right now (it's currently 4:20AM as I'm typing this AYYYYYYYYYY). I guess one thing I'm willing to share that I'm currently working on is a YouTube channel. So keep your eye out for that! I normally don't like to talk about what it is I'm thinking of doing because if I share these ideas with people and I don't commit to them, then I just feel hella guilty. But I mean this is my blog so I just want to share whatever goes on in my brain. Anyways I'm gonna end it here before I start rambling more, and if you made it this far in the blog post, all I could say is... *why*? But also thanks for reading!


UPDATE:
Well'p I did it. I made the client-side JavaScript fetch the data from my GitHub. You could read more about it HERE!
